content.question: Pickleco, a pickle-producing firm, hires labor and capital in perfectly competitive factor markets. The firm is minimizing its costs at the current production level. The marginal product of labor is <math alttext="100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units and the marginal product of capital is <math alttext="60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units. If the rental price of capital is <math alttext="$12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>12</mn></math>, what is the wage Pickleco is paying its workers?

topic.text: 5.3: Profit-Maximizing Behavior in Perfectly Competitive Factor Markets

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
